name: places/ChIJ_0j4mwz2wokRJ8dTxgKg20A
adrFormatAddress: 2034 5th Ave, New York, NY 10035-1563, USA

originalText.text:
The people were nice, but the work was subpar. I called the shop to verify that they could take down my previous style and wash my hair... when i asked the stylist, she got seemingly upset and said your hair is fine. (I workout 4 to 5 times a week and had my braids in for 4 weeks)... so it was pretty dirty.

I basically washed my own hair bc she didn't appear to know to wash the a scalp, not just rub through the hair. I didnt mind, but that was weird. (The rinse from my hair was brown and murky by the way, so I definitely needed the wash) Lastly the work... the picture is from the day of and though its not aweful, it looks 2 weeks old already. Not clean or neat work at all. They charged $60 for this style, but eventually said $50. I dont recommend this place or at least make sure you go to a good stylist. Mine was not very skilled...

EDIT:
I went back to the shop the same day and they redid my hair for no charge. I still stand by the first review, because I canceled travel plans to go back to the shop to get my hair rebraided within their 2-day correction window. That should have never happened. When they redid the style, it was much better and neater. Still, not the best work I have had, so ensure you find a good braider if you go. Be ware.

originalText.text: She will do your hair any kind of way you want it and it doesn't hurt I love going there it's worth the money

text.text: She will do your hair any kind of way you want it and it doesn't hurt I love going there it's worth the money

originalText.text:
Worst experience ever! Would not recommend to anyone and wish I could give 0 star.
Rude staff. "Oumou" (the owner?) told me to shut up when I was trying to explain the style I wanted because she cannot focus when I am talking. But then she had no problem talking to/yelling at the other ladies while doing my hair! She didn't respect me and also didn't do the style I wanted. She doesn't listen to customers. I am not even surprised...
The lady who started doing my hair was the worst! She was extremely slow and maybe took 10mn to do 1 braid. She stopped and went to eat and then prayed for some time when I told her I needed to leave by 1:30pm. She kept saying it would be done by then. Guest what? It was not! Usually this style takes 3 hours. I go to my hairdresser in the Bronx but didn't have time on that day since I was traveling.
Anyway, because of that slow witch, I almost missed my flight by 1mn, when I should have had plenty of time. Also she has dirty hands. I lost one full braid with my hair in it! I am so upset as it may not even grow again.
Anyway rude staff, gross place, unprofessional and disrespectful! Go to another place!

originalText.text:
Unfortunately Oumou tried to do knotless large box braids and couldn't deliver. They are all different sizes and not properly installed, despite showing her pictures multiple times. I tried to reach out to get ONE, JUST ONE unusually larger braid corrected (which was purposely done) and she ignored my texts. Who does that and why exactly are you upset?ðŸ˜‘

Very dissapointing as she seemed so nice at first. But this unfortunately happens a lot with inexperienced braiders. Nowadays, a lot of stylist (hair,nails,etc) are in need of money, so they embellish to get you in their chair. Beware. Look at the attached pic, this is 5 days later and looks nothing like knotless box braids....
Wow.

P.S. The water they dip your braids in to seal, is recycled from client to client. They do not use fresh water.

originalText.text: My hair came out nice. Ommah is the woman that does my hair. Will continue to keep coming to this hair braiding salon.
